text.0: helped indra maghavan by thee in war of old may we subdue in fight the men who strive with us conquer the men who war with us.
text.1: this day that now is close at hand bless him who pours the soma juice.
text.2: in this our sacrifice may we divide the spoil showing our strength the spoil of war.
text.3: in war which wins the light at the freegivers call at due oblation of the earlyrising one oblation of the active one.
text.4: indra slew even as we knowwhom each bowed head must reverence.
text.5: may all thy bounteous gifts be gathered up for us yea the good gifts of thee the good.
text.6: this food glows for thee as of old at sacrifice wherein they made thee chooser of the place for thou choosest the place of sacrifice.
text.7: speak thou and make it known to us they see within with beams of light.
text.8: indra indeed is found a seeker after spoil spoilseeker for his own allies.
text.9: so now must thy great deed be lauded as of old when for the aṅgirases thou openedst the stall openedst giving aid the stall.
text.10: in the same manner for us here fight thou and be victorious.
text.11: to him who pours the juice give up the lawless man the lawless who is wroth with us.
text.12: when with wise plan the hero leads the people forth they conquer in the ordered battle seeking fame press eager onward seeking fame.
text.13: to him in time of need they sing for life with offspring and with strength.
text.14: their hymns with indra find a welcome place of rest the hymns go forward to the gods.
text.15: indra and parvata our champions in the fight drive ye away each man who fain would war with us drive him far from us with the bolt.
text.16: welcome to him concealed afar shall he the lair that he hath found.
text.17: so may the render rend our foes on every side rend them o hero everywhere.
